intro: Matelea shortii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Matelea shortii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
